Night Shift continues to agree with Scorponok, to ease the suspicion that m=
ay arrise with his suddenly making himself known among the Predacons and De=
cepticons.  He simply nodds in agreement.

"Yeah ya got that right Scorpono=
k,looks like they were tryn' ta cut back on fuel costs of somethn'..  Fligh=
t takes a lot outa a bot, and if the creators can skimp on Energon expenses=
 they will.  You can blame those miserable Quintessons for that, greedy sla=
g balls they are.. I bet it was their idea ta skimp out on the flight capab=
ilities for future Decepticon generations.  One of these days I'm gonna sho=
ve that one in their faces.. All five of 'em."  

He gets the remainder of =
the arrows out of his legs, and manages to transform into SUV mode.  All th=
e while, Tucson still remaining still.

Night Shift knew exactly what direc=
tion to take as far as getting back to the Black Fortress.  It would be at =
least something that would save him from being suspected of treason.  He st=
arts his engine and waits for Scorponok.

"Ready when you are.  I'm sure Hy=
dras wants my full report, and I got plenty ta tell em.  Got lots ta tell y=
ou too.  Ohh yeah, some juicy gossip all right...  And it starts with Prett=
y boy there, who's on the ground.  He ain't gonna be down'n out for long, o=
hh no.  He's got too much power behind him ta do that.  He'll be out of it =
for some time, but I doubt no more than twenty four hours. But lemme tell y=
a the good stuff when we get back ta the fortress."

Tucson unsuspectedly s=
ets up a two way com link between what's happening within his radius and th=
e Ark.  He sends a text message back to Kup and Lord Elder.

" So far so go=
od.  Mild suspicion but nothing significant yet.  I think they're buying in=
to him.  When they go, and are well out of range, tell me, and I'll return =
inside the Ark.  Night Shift's doing his part, now it's my turn to do mine.=
"

He pauses between text messages.

" By the way, be ready to light our da=
rkest hour.  It's time."

For once, all the reservations, apprehensions and=
 anxieties Tucson had were all melting away.  He realized that there was no=
 going back to trying to correct the mistakes which he thought were already=
 made, but it was time to step forward and leave new legacies and bring new=
 hope to those who need it badly.  It was time to step up to the plate and =
accept destiny for what it was and not as he thought it should have been.  =
The Matrix had once asked him what his self worth was.  And now, he could s=
ee it.  He was worth a great deal. Not just as a warrior but as an innovato=
r, and a new light of hope for all Maximal, and Autobot kind.  Things did h=
appen along the way, which he thought he could controll, but now as he lies=
 motionless, he realizes that some times not all situations can be handled =
without some degree of difficulty.  There would be hard times, and Chaos wa=
s the balance between Harmony and insanity.  Without it there wouldn't be a=
 planet to protect and a universe to save.   He sends one more message to L=
ord Elder.

" I believe I owe another visit to Optimus Prime.  The Matrix m=
ay be expecting me."

bout it too. Unfortunately I'm stuck stickn' ta ground travel."
>

nok nodded as a frown appeared on his face. "You newer modeled
> Decepticon=
s with no flight capability." Scorponok said, his voice

nce and displeasure.  "What a waste."

e Scorpion mode. In this mode he was
> fully as large as an armored troop c=
arrier, his claws were large
> enough to engulf a warrior, At his rear a st=
inger was mounted that
> could easily reach to his front, and could double =
as a cannon, and
> multiple gun mounts positioned along his frame.
>

flexed his claws a couple times and then began to move quickly away
> from =
the vicinity of the Ark and towards Hydras' base, "Come on." he
> said impe=
riously.

into his
